newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela bolivar ends flat on CenBnk dlr sales.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela bolivar ends flat on CenBnk dlr sales.

text.p: The Venezuelan bolivar closed flat at 483.25/484.25 per dollar as strong seasonal demand for dollars to finance imports was met by ample Central Bank dollar sales, traders said.
"This is a traditional time for imports, for replenishing inventories and buying primary goods," said one trader. "Demand for dollars was strong, but the Central Bank supplied what was necessary."

Venezuela's foreign exchange market is unusual in that the Central Bank is its largest single supplier of dollars, which blurs the difference between the Central Bank supplying liquidity and intervening.
Venezuela continues to pursue an inflation-fighting strong bolivar policy, where the currency ostensibly floats between slowly depreciating bands set by Central Bank intervention.
Traders say the Bank has recently relaxed its strong bolivar policy, letting the unit gently slide before it brushes against the lower band, last re-set in December.
